cefr.title: Understanding CEFR Levels
cefr.intro: The Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) is an international standard for describing language ability, established by the Council of Europe in 2001.

A0.name: Beginner
A0.desc: Just starting; familiar expressions and basic introductions

A1.name: Elementary
A1.desc: Can understand and use familiar everyday expressions

A2.name: Pre-Intermediate
A2.desc: Can handle routine tasks and simple exchanges

B1.name: Intermediate
B1.desc: Can handle everyday situations and produce connected text on familiar topics

B2.name: Upper-Intermediate
B2.desc: Can interact independently, present viewpoints, and discuss advantages/disadvantages

C1.name: Advanced
C1.desc: Flexible, effective use; understands implicit meaning

cefr.parents_note: For Parents: Clear outcomes per level ensure measurable progress

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: We maintain small groups of 4-8 students to ensure personalized attention and meaningful interaction.
faq.a2: Classes meet twice weekly. Specific times are arranged based on group availability.
faq.a3: We conduct a brief speaking and writing assessment to determine the appropriate CEFR level.
faq.a4: We provide course materials (Life Vision textbooks for English). Students should bring a notebook and writing materials.
faq.a5: Monthly fees are due at the start of each month. We accept bank transfer and cash payments.
